name: 楊任軒
objective: This course introduces students to the environmental aspects of nanoscience and nanotechnology. We will study the fundamental physical-chemical properties, synthesis and characterization, environmental implications, health and environmental impact, and environmental applications of nanoparticles and nanomaterials. Topics about the generation, collection, and measurement of nano-particle will also be covered. Case studies from recent publications on engineered carbon nanomaterials and nanomaterials on catalysis will be discussed.
schedule:
1. Introduction of Environanotechnology
2. Physicochemical Properties of Nanomaterials
3. Synthesis Methods and Generation of Nanomaterials (1)
4. Synthesis Methods and Generation of Nanomaterials (2)
5. Characterization and Measurement of Nanomaterials (1)
6. Characterization and Measurement of Nanomaterials (2)
7. Nanomaterials for Environmental Pollutions (1)
8. Nanomaterials for Environmental Pollutions (2)
9. Mid-term report and presentation
10. Nanomaterials for Air Pollution Control
11. Nanomaterials for Wastewater Treatment
12. Nanomaterials for Solid Waste Treatment
13. Health and Environmental Impact of Nanotechnology
14. Challenges and Future Prospects of Nanotechnology
15. Special Topics in Nanotechnology (1)
16. Special Topics in Nanotechnology (2)
17. Final Report (1)
18. Final Report (2)
scorePolicy: Mid-term report and presentation (30%), Presentation, report, discussion (30%), Attendance (10%) and Participation via Zuvio (30%)
